description: Dynamic leg techniques that combine power, speed, and precision for both offensive and defensive applications.

safety: Always warm up thoroughly before kicking
Use proper footwear and surface conditions
Focus on form before height or power

techniques.description: Forward kick snapping from knee chamber, targeting midsection
techniques.detailedDescription: A fundamental forward kick where the leg snaps straight from chamber position, using the ball of the foot as primary striking surface.
techniques.application: Basic attacking kick to opponent's solar plexus, midsection, or face. Quick and direct.
steps: Lift knee to chamber position, thigh parallel to ground
Extend leg forward in snapping motion
Strike with ball of the foot
Quickly retract leg back to chamber
Return to ready stance
commonMistakes: Kicking with toes instead of ball of foot

techniques.description: Angled snap kick combining front and side kicking elements
techniques.detailedDescription: A versatile kick that combines elements of front and side kicking, delivered at a 45-degree angle to the target.
techniques.application: Attacking from angles, useful against opponents who defend straight attacks well.
steps: Chamber knee at 45-degree angle
Extend leg diagonally forward
Strike with ball of the foot
Keep hips partially rotated for power
Retract quickly to chamber position
commonMistakes: Loss of balance due to angle

techniques.description: Defensive kick used to check opponent's attacks and create distance
techniques.detailedDescription: A defensive kicking technique used to stop opponent's advance, block attacks, or create space between combatants.
techniques.application: Stopping forward-moving opponents, blocking low attacks, and creating defensive space.
steps: Lift knee quickly to defensive position
Extend leg to meet opponent's advance
Make contact with sole or shin
Push opponent back or deflect attack
Retract immediately to defensive stance

techniques.description: Pushing kick using sole of foot to move opponent or create distance
techniques.detailedDescription: A pushing technique using the entire sole of the foot to press against opponent, moving them backward or off balance.
techniques.application: Creating distance, breaking opponent's balance, setting up follow-up techniques.
steps: Chamber knee high for maximum reach
Extend leg with pushing motion
Contact with entire sole of foot
Push through target with body weight
Retract quickly to avoid grabbing
commonMistakes: Pushing with toes instead of sole

techniques.description: Powerful side kick penetrating through target with heel
techniques.detailedDescription: A strong side-oriented kick that penetrates through targets using the heel or blade of the foot as primary weapon.
techniques.application: Powerful attacks to midsection, ribs, or head. Effective for breaking techniques.
steps: Rotate hips fully to side position
Chamber knee high across body
Thrust leg sideways with penetrating force
Strike with heel or foot blade
Retract along same path

techniques.description: Overhead kick striking downward onto target
techniques.detailedDescription: A kick delivered from high to low, striking downward onto opponent's head, shoulders, or collarbone.
techniques.application: Attacking taller opponents, striking down on bent-over opponents, or breaking high targets.
steps: Chamber knee high with flexibility
Extend leg downward in axe-like motion
Strike with heel or bottom of foot
Use gravity to enhance power
Retract quickly to avoid imbalance

techniques.description: Powerful kick thrusting backward to strike rear targets
techniques.detailedDescription: A strong backward kick delivered while facing away from target, using heel for powerful rear attacks.
techniques.application: Surprise attacks to rear opponents, escaping from grabs, or when turned away from attacker.
steps: Look over shoulder to locate target
Chamber knee forward then thrust backward
Strike with heel to target
Use hip thrust for additional power
Retract quickly and turn to face opponent

techniques.description: Circular kick using instep, combining hip rotation and snapping motion
techniques.detailedDescription: A fundamental circular kick using the instep of the foot, combining full hip rotation with snapping leg extension.
techniques.application: Versatile attack to head, body, or legs. Most commonly used kicking technique in sparring.
steps: Pivot on supporting foot, turning hips
Chamber knee across body
Snap leg in circular motion
Strike with instep of foot
Retract quickly to stance
commonMistakes: Kicking with shin instead of instep

techniques.description: Circular kick delivered from side stance with hip rotation
techniques.detailedDescription: A turning kick executed from side-facing position, combining circular motion with side kick power principles.
techniques.application: Angular attacks, catching opponents off guard from side angles, combination with side techniques.
steps: Start from side stance position
Pivot while chambering knee
Execute circular kick with side power
Strike with instep or ball of foot
Return to side stance position
commonMistakes: Loss of side power in circular motion

techniques.description: Back-leg hooking kick catching opponent from unexpected angle
techniques.detailedDescription: A hooking technique using the back leg to strike from reverse angle, often catching opponents by surprise.
techniques.application: Surprise attacks, countering against aggressive opponents, hitting around guards.
steps: Pivot on front foot, turning back to target
Chamber back leg in hooking motion
Swing leg in circular hooking path
Strike with heel or sole of foot
Retract and face opponent quickly

techniques.description: Powerful side-oriented push kick for creating maximum distance
techniques.detailedDescription: A strong pushing kick delivered sideways, using full body weight to create maximum distance from opponent.
techniques.application: Creating defensive space, breaking opponent's stance, stopping forward momentum.
steps: Rotate hips fully to side position
Chamber knee high across body
Thrust leg sideways with pushing force
Contact with sole of foot
Push through target with body weight

techniques.description: Circular kick using back leg with reverse hip action
techniques.detailedDescription: A turning kick executed with the back leg, requiring reverse hip coordination and generating power from opposite rotation.
techniques.application: Powerful surprise attacks, countering techniques, and combination sequences.
steps: Pivot on front foot, turning hips reverse
Chamber back leg for circular motion
Execute turning kick with reverse power
Strike with instep of foot
Return to balanced stance

techniques.description: Circular hooking motion striking with heel from outside-in
techniques.detailedDescription: A deceptive kick using circular hooking motion to strike around opponent's guard, typically targeting head or ribs.
techniques.application: Deceptive attacks around guards, striking unprotected areas, combination setups.
steps: Chamber knee in circular path
Swing leg in hooking motion outside-in
Strike with heel or back of foot
Use hip rotation to enhance power
Retract along circular path

techniques.description: Sweeping circular kick in crescent moon shape
techniques.detailedDescription: A sweeping kick following crescent-shaped path, used for blocking, sweeping, or striking with instep.
techniques.application: Blocking attacks, sweeping opponent's guard, striking head or weapons.
steps: Lift leg in circular crescent path
Sweep across target area
Contact with instep or shin
Follow through crescent motion
Return to balanced position

techniques.description: Vertical kicks striking with outside or inside foot edge
techniques.detailedDescription: Pair of vertical kicks using either inward or outward motion, striking with the blade edges of the foot.
techniques.application: Close-range attacks, breaking techniques, precision strikes to specific targets.
steps: Chamber knee high vertically
Extend leg upward in vertical line
Strike with foot blade (inside or outside)
Maintain vertical alignment
Retract quickly to chamber

techniques.description: Kick thrusting upward to strike high targets from below
techniques.detailedDescription: An upward-thrusting kick targeting opponent's chin, arms, or weapons from low position.
techniques.application: Striking upward against taller opponents, attacking from crouch position, breaking high holds.
steps: Chamber from low position
Thrust leg upward powerfully
Strike with ball of foot or instep
Use upward body momentum
Retract quickly to defensive position

techniques.description: Advanced kick combining multiple rotations and directional changes
techniques.detailedDescription: A master-level kick involving complex body twists, multiple rotations, and deceptive directional changes.
techniques.application: Advanced combination attacks, breaking multiple targets, demonstration of ultimate kicking mastery.
steps: Initiate complex body rotation
Chamber with twisting motion
Execute kick with directional change
Strike with precise timing and power
Recover with complete control
commonMistakes: Loss of power during complex motion
